title: Many r packages are out of date
body:
## Please note that everything still works, as list_url is used to find the old versions. I have not checked to see if all r packages have list_url specified, however

Related: #2951

cran.r-project.org places latest versions of things in a different directory than archived versions. For example:

r-bh 1.65.0-1 used to be located at https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/BH_1.65.0-1.tar.gz, but it is now located at https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/BH/

The current version, r-bh 1.66.0-1, is only located in https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/ and not https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/BH/

This affects (at least) the following packages:
r-backports
r-checkmate
r-digest
r-lazyeval
r-mass
r-stringi
r-stringr
r-reshape2
r-viridislite
r-tibble
r-xml
r-httpuv
r-testthat
r-bh
r-plogr
r-bindrcpp
r-dbi
r-hexbin

---

Instead of separate package.py files for everything listed in cran.r-project.org, would it be possible to integrate with their distribution system directly? By this, I mean:
`spack install r-a`
would look for https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/a_.*.tar.gz for the most recent version and https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/a for older versions and (somehow) automatically pull out dependencies

If that direct use of https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/ isn't what you want in spack, could you instead write a script to periodically crawl it and generate package.py files for everything there?

Thanks
